title: Why do scientists call nasty things after themselves? Diseases (Alzheimer), bacteria (bordetella) and stuff like that. It taints so many people's names, not just the scientists themselves. - Quora

response.answer_text: In the past, it was traditional to name an illness or bacterium after the discoverer. This still happens to some extent. Astronomers name things after discoverers, biologists name things to honor people.
